page.title: 14Language
page.content: The Welsh Language is in daily use by a large proportion of the population. Many older people use English only when they must, and great efforts are made to re-inforce the use of Welsh from an early age in schools.This means that most of the children are ultimately bilingual.Gwynedd County Council subsidises Adult Education classes in Welsh.Many religious services are conducted in Welsh. Trefriw holds its own Eisteddfod each year. Official notices,place names on sign posts,public accounts such as rates, gas, electricity and telephones are submitted bilingually. Television in this area on Channel Four is not broadcast in the English version, but is replaced by the largely Welsh programmes of S4C.
